what can i do when i get access denied message
access denied message in my account
responses: The possible reasons for this are: •You have not used the NetBanking facility for more than 999 days (in this case you need to attempt logging in again after 24 hrs). •You have entered the wrong IPIN (password) five times (in this case you need to attempt logging in again after 24 hrs).  •If you have forgotten your IPIN, then we regenerate the IPIN based on an authenticated request from you

patterns: what to do to block pin
responses: We will need a written instruction from you to block your IPIN. Alternatively, you can contact our PhoneBanking Services.

patterns: what to do if my pin is not working
responses: Your IPIN (password) may not work if:•You have not entered the same lower or upper case as mentioned in the IPIN envelope sent to you. Remember the IPIN password is case sensitive.•You have not accessed your account for more than 999 days (in this case you need to attempt logging in again after 24 hrs).

patterns: how to change the mode of repayment for a loan
responses: In the event that you wish to change the mode of repayment/bank account for your loan repayment, you may visit the nearest the Retail Loan Service Center and submit your request with the revised account mandate/instructions.
The National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT) system is a nation-wide funds transfer system to facilitate transfer of funds from any bank branch to any other bank branch.

SI stands for Standing Instructions. It is one of the modes you can use to repay a loan, wherein your HDFC Bank account is directly debited for the EMI amounts, based on your specific instructions in the form of the Standing Instructions Mandate.
A Guarantor is a person who guarantees to pay for someone else's debt if he or she should default on a loan obligation.
A right over the security is created in favour of HDFC Bank. Hence shares cannot be transferred or sold by the customer or shareholder.
Removal of a pledge from the security to regain the rights over the security is called de-pledge.*Conditions Apply
Amortization is paying off debts in regular instalments over a period of time.

RTGS is the Real Time Gross Settlement which is used for the transfer of amounts of Rs. 1,00,000 or more from one bank account to another bank account (any bank located anywhere in India if attached with an Internet system) at very minimal charges. The amount is credited into the beneficiary's account in real time. For amounts less than Rs. 1,00,000 we use NEFT( National Electronic Fund Transfer).
